dialogue.raw_text: See, the Yin is the negative - the darkside. And the Yang represents positive - good. If you like, the first is earth and the second heaven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY - A LITTLE LATER Larry still talks.       Phil now looks bored.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Yin Yang symbol is really evocative about the whole concept. As you travel around the circle, white or black will increase until the opposite color is almost gone. But never totally gone, right? And this cycle then repeats for the opposite color.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY - A LITTLE LATER Larry still talks, glancing across to Phil to make his point every now and then. Phil is tossing a cigarette into the air and trying to catch it between his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a crash, and the car slams to a halt. Larry is thrown forward, but manages to grab the wheel. Phil is not so lucky, and catapults into the dashboard, before being thrown back into his seat, the crumpled cigarette still gripped between his teeth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What seems like Yin is often supported by Yang, and vice versa. Let me give you an example: To truly know good, you must first know evil, and without good as a comparison, nothing can be evil. So by allowing Yin to flourish, you welcome Yan. By letting go of Yin, you are waiting for its return. Another example is...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY Bernice has driven into a road sign set into a concrete pillar. In fact, the sign that Bernice has driven into is the only thing anywhere near the road for miles in any direction.

direction.raw_text: . DAY Phil is dazed. He checks his forehead, which is bleeding. Then he gazes out at the desolate road and the solitary, buckled sign.

direction.raw_text: Phil looks out of the window at the vast expanse of nothing but desert.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It would be really nice if we could get through a couple of hours without crashing the car.

dialogue.raw_text: I was distracted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course you were.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : There is a faint noise. Larry hears it first and then Phil and then, as they strain to identify it, they see a tiny dot on the road ahead of them, which grows and grows as they watch it, and they peer hard into the wind to identify it and... it's a motorcycle cop.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't believe it. Middle of nowhere, and... quick - stand in front of the car!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY They jump out of the car and shuffle sideways, until they are standing in front of the actual point of collision.

dialogue.raw_text: What now?

dialogue.raw_text: Pretend we're having a conversation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.   What about?

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what about! Ever since I met you, you've talked. Yabba, yabba, yabba, every waking minute. Religion, your supersonic, supercharged car, the darkside. Now you need to talk, and you can't think of anything to say.

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever your damn fool religion is called, I think it works.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... it's more a philosophy than a religion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, well done. Good work.

dialogue.raw_text: The reason I ask, is that you appear to have driven into one of our road signs.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.

dialogue.raw_text: (bitterly) We're going to be arrested, that's what we're going to do. Then we'll go to court and then we'll go to jail and we'll do that for a while.

direction.raw_text: Larry starts the car. He throws it into reverse and the bumper slowly disengages from the metal signpost. Suddenly the car tears loose and flies backwards, smashing into the cop's motorcycle, leaving him holding the radio and its trailing wire. Larry slams on the brakes.

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, that would be great. Then we could suspend you from a bridge in a straitjacket and set the rope on fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, really. I really can slip these cuffs.

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.   Show me.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I think we should go.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nicely done.

The cop gets his gun out of his holster, and Phil reaches into the glove box and pulls out the screwdriver. He leans across Larry, jams it into the wheel column, and snaps the steering lock in two. The hearse's direction immediately changes.

dialogue.raw_text: If you hate Phil so much, why are you chasing him across California?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's got Gram and I need him.

direction.raw_text: Barbara shoots her a withering look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that's really touching. But... you've got to come to terms with the fact that he's dead.

dialogue.raw_text: I know he's dead, Honey. But he hasn't been officially identified, and there's no certificate of death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's just say I'm overly sentimental, okay?

dialogue.raw_text: This is all about money, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't everything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you think you deserve anything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was a great support to Gram before Kaufman came along and spoiled the party.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phil's not responsible for your problems with Gram.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know that he can be a pain in the ass, but when it came to Gram, Phil only ever did the right thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In his whole life, Phil Kaufman didn't do anything because it was the right thing to do. You can bet the ranch that wherever he is, he's having some fun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Barbara laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susie leans over, grabs the safety brake and pulls it up hard. The car swerves and skids to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbara dismisses her anger with a tight little smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe that's what I like about him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure it is, honey. That's why your bags were packed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you any idea what it's like to really love someone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You might exclusively love Phil Kaufman - but unfortunately, so does he. You're just handy to have around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have to listen to this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, you vindictive bitch. I'm going with you to Joshua Tree because my life seems to have been turned upside down and I want to know why. But you don't know me and I won't let you judge me. Do it again and I'll smash that pretty little face of yours off the fucking road. Got it?

dialogue.raw_text: The truth can hurt, can't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not 'til I met you...

dialogue.raw_text: Pull over - let's... eat.

dialogue.raw_text: Let's not. The cops'll be after us and we should just get on to Palm Springs and do the thing, and then I can get home and you can... do whatever it is you do. Let's do that.

dialogue.raw_text: We need to stop. I'm starting to get hungry. I'm not nice hungry.

dialogue.raw_text: You surprise me.    I vote we keep going.

dialogue.raw_text: What gave you the impression this was a democracy?

direction.raw_text: . POLYONAX PLACE. DAY The hearse pulls up around the back of the building, and parks in a place that is hidden from the road. Phil gets out and stretches. He is joined by Larry, and they both peer round the side of the building to check that they have not been observed. Then they walk towards the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY A Police Car with siren blaring and lights flashing speeds past on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY We are with a short-order cook. He expertly flips a burger from a hotplate and adds it to a plate overflowing with bacon, sausage and fries. He slips this plate onto a tray on which there is a second plate containing two pieces of plain bread and some lettuce. He dings a bell and a waiter enters and picks up the tray. direction.raw_text: Stanley pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley thinks about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil doesn't like the inference.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another 'bang' from the bathroom.   Stanley turns to Larry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a long pause.    Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil closes his eyes. Stanley picks up the receiver and starts to dial. Then Phil jumps up off the bed and walks out of the room. After a moment, Larry and Susie follow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S) Bastard!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I only failed because I couldn't save him from himself. You failed him all his life. You never believed. I never doubted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. You tell me why I should let you take my boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was his road manager and his friend. We loved it out here in the desert, and we made a pact that whoever died first, the other would come down here and set them free. Gram gave his word and I gave mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a couple of druggies.   Why should I believe you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't take drugs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about you? Are you a druggie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.    Yes I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Phil is waiting by the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry gives Phil the screwdriver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't right. Larry walks away leaving Phil with Susie.         He looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a moment, Phil walks back into room eight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Larry) Nice work. Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just do whatever feels right to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God damn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Stanley is sitting on the bed, the receiver in his hand. Phil sits facing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is another 'crash' from inside the bathroom.        The door shakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry and Susie quietly enter the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you call them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you going to call them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you haven't given me a reason not to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There isn't a reason. If someone tried to steal my son's body, I'd stop them. For sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you are prepared to go to jail?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm expecting to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Phil and Stanley look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry holds his hand up to stop Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil shoots Larry a dangerous look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S) Don't you worry - it's gonna happen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mister Parsons?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it, son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been a junkie for over four years. I started taking heroin on June 5th 1969 at a concert in Indiana. I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't need...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've taken heroin, speed, uppers, downers, blues, morphine, methadone, mushrooms, quaaludes, acid, valium, barbiturates, straight LSD, marijuana, marijuana laced with opium, nembutal, mescalin of course, and medical methaqualone, which made me shake uncontrollably for six weeks and vomit every hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dryly) That's very impressive, son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not my point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Better make the point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I started working my way through that list on June 5th 1969, and since then there hasn't been a day when I didn't at least smoke one joint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Larry ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all look at him.   He gestures at Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the silence, Susie walks over and grips Phil's hand. Then Stanley gets up off the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone looks surprised. Phil gives Larry a look of appreciative approval. Barbara starts to kick furiously at the door from inside the bathroom. Stanley pauses for a moment, and then walks outside. Phil and Larry watch him go, and Susie walks over to kiss Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three of them move to the door, and Phil turns to Larry.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are we sure that this is helping?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And now I've stopped. I stopped because it seems that I had something more important to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's doing this because he gave his word. I'm prepared to do this now because I think it's right. And because I believe that each body has a soul. And Gram's soul doesn't belong in a family plot surrounded by strangers. It belongs here, where he was happiest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to go say goodbye to my son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's for failing to reinforce my expectations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... I'll have to do that more often.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you really take all those drugs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : (3) He grins at Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door of the bathroom shakes and one of the hinges flies across the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I may have got a little carried away...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon, time to go...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Phil, Larry and Susie leave room eight. They look around with surprise, but there is no sign of Stanley. Phil opens the back of the hearse and takes a quick peek inside the casket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry is already behind the wheel.   Phil opens the car door and looks at Susie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gets in. There is a final, almighty 'crash' from inside room eight. The three of them look at each other, and then Bernice is gone into the darkness. A moment later Barbara runs outside. She leaps into her car and screeches after them. In the distance a blue flashing police light suddenly materializes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Just checking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, he took the body and stuffed it in the trunk of his car before escaping into the night.

dialogue.raw_text: Are you coming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I reckon I am.

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Barbara is on the road, driving fast. Suddenly a blue flashing police light fills her mirror.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Barbara gives it everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cop turns on his torch and peers at her carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just stares at her.      Barbara is losing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long pause. Barbara realizes that she might have gone too far. He starts to write a ticket.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Evenin' ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please help me, they've got my boyfriend's corpse and they're going to perform a ritual with his body.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May I see your driving license please, ma'am?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My driving license?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've just told you that they've stolen a body and you want to see my driving license?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You people are supposed to be on the lookout for a hearse. A hearse is a big long car. You can usually tell which ones are the hearses, because they have coffins in the back. The one we're looking for is painted yellow. Does this look like a yellow hearse to you, asshole?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that a ticket? Are you writing me a ticket?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes it is, ma'am. And yes I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Phil indicates an area just off the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry pulls the hearse over near the rock. They all sit there for a moment. Phil and Larry look at each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cap Rock. This is perfect. Really peaceful...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Phil opens the back of the hearse and slides the casket out of the car. He notices that Larry has made no move to help. Susie sits on a rock and watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry walks over and grabs the other end of the casket. They walk it away from the car and lay it down. As they lower it, the coffin slips out of Phil's hands and bangs down in the sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stand and stare at the casket.      Susie walks over with the guitar and takes Phil's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets the gasoline can from the car and stands over the casket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks off. Phil puts the can down and removes the top of the casket. He peers inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You wanna give me a hand here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, Gram.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now we... do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take the top off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Flesh burns easier than wood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't believe you just said that. I'm not taking the top off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He pours some gasoline into the casket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Against his better judgment, Larry walks over and peers inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil pours a little more fuel in.       He looks over at Susie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She backs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil stops pouring and shakes the can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pours the rest of the can into the casket. Susie walks over to stand next to Phil. He looks down at Gram.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all stare at the casket. Phil wipes a tear away and tucks a can of beer into the coffin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Gram) Hey, man. Looking a little peaky...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some decorum would be nice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think that's enough?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I don't know.   Maybe a little more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not having a conversation with you about how much gasoline you need to burn a body.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think that'll do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only a little left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry I wasn't there for you when it mattered, but I was there before, and I've been there ever since. Gram, good luck to you, wherever you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He rests Gram's guitar against the casket, takes big puffs on his cigar to get the flame up, then tosses it into the coffin. They wait. Nothing happens. Phil edges nearer and looks inside. Then the coffin explodes into flames. All three of them are thrown backwards by the blast.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's my last one, man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The traffic cop is finishing the ticket when there is a ball of flame in the distance. Barbara just scowls.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus!    What the hell's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That'll be Gram Parsons, on fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get in the car, ma'am.   Now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Phil, Larry and Susie pick themselves up. They stare at the pyre. Phil is close to tears, and Susie puts her arm around him. For a moment, Phil thinks he sees the flames morph into the shape of an angel over the burning coffin. The image disappears when Larry speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He breaks off as a flashing police light appears in the darkness, followed by a siren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry and Susie run to the car. Phil lingers a moment, looking down at the flames. Then he follows the others.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe too much fuel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nah, I just didn't factor in the booze inside of him. Gram always...

dialogue.raw_text: I think our work here is done.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : The huge car screeches off into the darkness, with no lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT Stanley watches as the hearse flies past him. He glances back at the fire, smiles sadly, and bows his head for a moment. Then he turns on the ignition and drives away into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT The police car arrives at the scene.       Barbara and the cop get out. He peers into the flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The traffic cop stares into the fire.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know it's your boyfriend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sarcastically) I recognize that birthmark on his shoulder. Look, can I make an observation?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be my guest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're in the desert. It is dark. If you want to catch someone in the dark, it's best not to turn on big flashing lights and make a loud noise with a siren.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want to know what I think, ma'am?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. But I'm really, really keen to find out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think it was suicide. He just wanted to get away from you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAWN Phil is fast asleep and snoring in Bernice's passenger seat. He wakes slowly and shields his eyes from the bright sunshine that pours through the windscreen. He pulls a flask out of the glove compartment and takes a long gargle, spitting the result out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Then he glances in the rear view mirror and sees the man sitting in the casket bay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gram pulls himself along the bay and onto the back seat. He then climbs into the front, settles next to Phil and holds his hand out for the flask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes a drink and looks around.

direction.raw_text: He takes another drink and hands the flask back to Phil.

dialogue.raw_text: Sure is hot.

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Gram.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Phil.

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think you should?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not gonna hurt me now, is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice wheels. Very stylish.

dialogue.raw_text: They're very handy for transporting dead people around. Nothing better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am dead, then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're more than dead, Gram. You and the box are down to bones and brass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, well.    Here's mud in your eye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What can I do for you, Gram?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You assume I want something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you're here. And seeing as I just burned you to a cinder, you shouldn't be. (MOR E)

direction.raw_text: Gram grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gram holds his hand out for the bottle and takes a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Gram is now Larry, peering down at Phil.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So I'm guessing you've got some kind of reason.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, okay. I just wanted to say thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doing the thing that we agreed, keeping your word, keeping them all away...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that's okay, Gram.    But I don't need thanking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm just taking care of business. That's what you paid me for - that's what I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You shooting for a raise?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, I just quit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I s'pose I should be getting along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye, Gram. I'm glad it all worked out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said I'm glad it all worked out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All what worked out?

direction.raw_text: : (3) Phil sits bolt upright and looks around the car.   Larry and Susie stare back at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Doesn't matter. Can we go now? I'm getting sick of sand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DAY We hear Gram's: 'Return Of The Grievous Angel' or some similar music. We follow Bernice as she drives through the desert, and into Los Angeles. We follow her through the city streets, and we stay with her as she parks. Fade down music.

direction.raw_text: . DAY Phil turns off the ignition and sits back in his seat.   He and Larry look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans across to hug Phil, who looks awkward and pats him on the shoulder instead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil pulls a cigar out of his pocket and lights it. The handcuff dangles from his wrist and bangs against the dash. He stares at the match as it burns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil blows the match out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all get out of the car.

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we did it.    We saved a soul.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Singed my damn mustache, that's for sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, shall we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.    Let's roll, hippie.

dialogue.raw_text: Where d'you think you might be when I'm done?
